info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 10:09PM CDT until July 15 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
At 1009 PM CDT Tuesday, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and public reports.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ashland, Washburn, Sanborn, Iron River, Lake Nebagamon, Barnes, Barksdale, Brule, Solon Springs, Drummond, Gordon, Town of Delta, Ino, Benoit, Odanah, Bennett, Mason, Lake Owen, Upper Eau Claire Lake and Grand View.
Forest roads and low-water crossings are likely being impacted across the warned area. Rainfall amounts of 5 to 8 inches were reported near Barnes in Bayfield County. Use extreme caution if traveling tonight.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL ASHLAND, BAYFIELD AND SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Ashland, WI; Bayfield, WI; Douglas, WI
